info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 4:54AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IS UPGRADED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning through Monday, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet with localized amounts up to 4 feet over higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet through Sunday, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, elevations above 2000 feet including Fort Jones to Callahan, Sawyers Bar Road, Highway 3, higher portions of Highway 96 and mountains in Western Siskiyou County. For the Winter Weather Advisory, elevations between 1500 and 2000 feet, including Scott Bar and portions of Highway 96. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
